acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48 hours LC50=0.185mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 2003).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal roue) value of >2,000mg/kg, together with the absence of mortality at this level (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1993)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Classification cannot be determined, though the available rat inhalation study reported the LC50 value of >1.02mg/L (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1993)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS criteria and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 2,800mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1993)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: There was no treatment-related increase in tumor incidence observed in 2-year (rats) and 18-month (mice) carcinogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1993)).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since acute toxicity was Category 1 and there was no rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), and since there wasbio-accumulation (log Kow=4.94 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances with melting point of >55degC are not available (melting point: 90degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)).

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data in in vitro reverse mutation tests, in vitro chromosome aberration tests and in vivo mouse mutagenicity tests (micronucleus tests) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1993)).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing chlorine (but not fluorine and oxygen), with the chlorine bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on the evidence of increased fetal mortality, increased incidence of fetal malformation and increased visceral/skeletal anomalies at parentally toxic doses observed in rat teratogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1993)). Since it cannot be clearly demonstrated that these findings of offspring effects are secondary to parental toxicity, the substance is classified into Category 2.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test method applicable to liquid substances are not available (melting point: 90degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data), test temperature: 140degC).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of mild irritation with effects clearing up after 24 hours, observed in rabbit eye irritation studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1993)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on no evidence of irritation observed in rabbit skin irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1993)).

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on positive results in guinea pig skin sensitization tests employing the Buehler method (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1993)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification: Category 2 (blood system, spleen, urinary bladder, liver)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (blood system, spleen, urinary bladder, liver)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including hemolytic anemia, increased spleen weights, increased hemosiderin deposition in the spleen, darkening/swelling of the spleen and hepatic centrilobular hypertrophy. Bladder effects (edema, congestion, and hypertrophy of mucosal epithelial cells) were also noted (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1993)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including piloerection, abnormal posture (crouching), abnormal gait (staggering), coma, pale limbs, decreased respiration rate, and increased salivation (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1993)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.
